ideas.content: An app where you can hire an actor to come to save you from a date.
A smart fridge that adjusts the light depending on how bright the room is.
An electrified wristband that activates every time it recognizes you spending too much time on social media or your phone in general.
A Gmail feature that condenses long emails and paraphrases them into bullet points.
Tinder for finding the right flatmate.
An audiobook featuring different voices for each character and a separate narrator voice.
A social network that encourages kindness and has zero tolerance for user abuse.
An app where you and your friends can raise a digital pet.
GMAIL should have a feature to warn you if you try and send an email which ends with “Best retards” instead of “Best regards.”
WhatsApp has a feature that allows individual characters to appear on the recipient’s screen in real-time.
Wolverine-style gloves for cutting your food.
A washing machine window that doubles as a submarine, featuring real-life videos of the underwater sea with fishes, sharks, and whales.
An iPhone holder that, upon removal, makes the metallic unsheathing sound heard in sword-fighting movies.
An app designed to track your mental health.
A vape that acts like a mouthwash.
A way to grow melons small enough to fit in the palm of your hand.
Foot spa but for your shoes that offers restoration and maintenance of all types of footwear.
iPhone should have a timer on your locked home screen of the last time you unlocked your device.
Cinema-style popcorn and pick-and-mix delivery service.
Card readers should be built into restaurant tables so you can pay and leave quickly.
AI that can scan any artwork and show you the materials, colour palette, etc., used to create such artwork.
A website that can automatically generate an itinerary based on the destination given.
An app for kids’ phones where every 1/2 hour, they have to answer 2 math problems to continue using social media apps.
iPhone feature where if you sneeze, Siri says “Bless you.”
Auto-scroll feature for iPhone with the ability to adjust speed.
A Chrome feature that tells you what the password requirements were when you were creating the original password.
Butter that comes in slices the same size as bread.
An app that locates the nearest public bin.
A podcast that plays DVD commentaries.
Siri feature where I can tell her what I have in my fridge, and she will give me recipe ideas.
